title.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Sept. 28, 1895. Contributions for St. Hedwig Parish Fair Continue to Flow In

div.bibl: Dziennik Chicagoski, Sept. 28, 1895. CONTRIBUTIONS FOR ST. HEDWIG PARISH FAIR CONTINUE TO FLOW IN

body.p: Contributions for the proposed St. Hedwig Parish fair continue to flow in, according to the parish committee. Acknowledgment is given of the following donations:
Francis Kielma: five dollars and an accordion.
Pauline Tocha: one table set.
Rose 9 of the Women's Sodality of St. Hedwig Parish: $7.45.
Rosalie Trajder: three bouquets and kitchen utensils.
Francis Baczkowski: one long German smoking pipe and a beautiful potted flower.
Catherine Zacharek: one table cloth.
John Ornas: one canary and bird cage.
Clementine Suchomska: three handmade bouquets.
P. Moszczynski: two beautiful aprons.
Ignace Krajecki: three bouquets and one oleander.
Alexander Tabert: two rabbits.
Rose 7 of the Women's Sodality of St. Hedwig Parish: $5.25.
Joseph Szwichtenberg: five dollars.
Joan Richter: five dollars.
Julius Recka: 26 pairs of boots, 4 hats, 14 caps, and a gross of collars.
Juliana Piszke: one bag of flour and two pairs of pigeons.
Marion Chojnacka: two canaries and two bird cages.
Catherine Poteracka: one canary and bird cage and two flower vases.
Further announcement of contributions will be made in tomorrow's issue. Sincere thanks are extended to the donors.
